intro: Dudleya hendrixii, commonly known as the Santa Barbara dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green with a powdery coating. The plant produces vibrant orange or red flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
